creator: tobias.selb@gmail.com
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
As far as I can see the crash happens in the class com.inet.tds.n. This seems to belong to a JDBC driver by i-net software and is definitely not distributed as part of Tomcat. I suggest you open an issue a i-net and also at Orace (concerning the JRockit JVM). Neither software should crash n case of errors.

Regards,

Rainer

creator: tobias.selb@gmail.com
text: I've already opened an issue at i-net, but they told me that the driver is 100% pure java and could not cause such a crash.

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
That's why you should also talk to Oracle about JRockit.

Alhough you have loaded the Tomcat tcnative library, which is native, that library is not involved in the stack that is shown as being responsible for the crash. Although we can't rule out 100%, that the native lib could corrupt memory somewhow, there is no known issue about this at the moment and I would recommend escalating in direction of JRockit.

Regards,

Rainer

creator: tobias.selb@gmail.com
text:
OK, i've opened an issue in the JRockit support forum. If someone is struggling with a similar problem, take a look here:

http://forums.oracle.com/forums/thread.jspa?messageID=4473793
